oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The Survival of Bovine Viral Diarrhea Virus on Materials Associated with Livestock Production
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Stevens, Elliot T.
Thomson, Daniel U.
Wileman, Ben
O'Dell, Sean
Chase, Christopher C. L.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: bovine viral diarrhea virus
BVDV
fomite
materials
liquid
NCP
synthetic mucus
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Although research has demonstrated bovine viral diarrhea virus (BVDV) can be transmitted by a fomite, there are no published studies on the longitudinal survival of BVDV on common materials and within liquids used in livestock production that could serve as fomites. The objective of this study was to evaluate the longitudinal survival of a type lb, non-cytopathic (NCP) BVDV on fomites in the presence or absence of a novel, synthetic mucus.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2011; 146-147
